page.title: 20FRILSHAM & MARLSTON- SUMMARY
page.content: This beautiful area of{South Berkshire with its lovely beech woods and fine views, its winding lanes and wild flowers is dominated by the names of the{Palmer, Astor, Ilife and Eling families. They formerly owned most of the area- lived in Marlston Manor, Frilsham Manor, Hawkridge House or the farms attached to them. These estates are now broken up. Those feudal days are over but there is no doubt that these{"gentry"}were good employers and loved by their employees. We have lost a great deal with their passing. The coming of the M4 in 1972 was a bitter blow to the feudal type of life in this area and was much resented by older inhabitants. New ways of life now-but old values live on. **************************** {This survey was carried out by members {of the Ashmore Green Womens Institute.
